about.title: About me
about.subtitle: My background, experience, and how I approach software development.
about.content:
Hi, I'm Tomas, a junior developer with experience in real-world work environments, including web applications, internal systems, and databases.

I started my career working with PHP and SQL, optimizing queries and maintaining production systems. Today, I’m deepening my knowledge in Java with Spring Boot and React, focused on building modern, well-structured, and maintainable applications.

I feel comfortable working in remote teams, following agile methodologies, and reading and improving existing code step by step. I’m motivated to keep learning and to grow within teams that value technical quality and the real-world impact of software.

experience.title: Experience
experience.subtitle: Real roles where I delivered on development, performance, and systems.

bullet.b1: Developed and maintained full-stack web applications using PHP (Symfony), JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and MySQL.
bullet.b2: Designed and implemented new features and modules based on business requirements.
bullet.b3: Refactored and fixed legacy code, improving stability and maintainability.
bullet.b4: Optimized database queries and application performance, reducing response times and improving UX.
bullet.b5: Worked in an agile environment using Jira (Kanban) and Bitbucket, participating in code reviews and planning.
bullet.b6: Collaborated with product and internal teams to deliver solutions for employees and external clients.
bullet.b7: Contributed to code quality improvements through refactoring and best practices.

bullet.b1: Participated in the migration of data to a new ERP system.
bullet.b2: Analyzed and optimized complex SQL queries, reducing execution times from hours to seconds.
bullet.b3: Collaborated with the team to improve data reliability and system performance.
bullet.b4: Identified performance bottlenecks and proposed optimization strategies.

bullet.b1: Managed and maintained SQL Server databases (DDL, DML, DCL), supporting business-critical systems.
bullet.b2: Created reports and data analysis using SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS).
bullet.b3: Developed an internal Risk Management System (VB.NET) for the Quality area.
bullet.b4: Administered Microsoft Dynamics GP at a basic level, supporting users and business processes.
bullet.b5: Provided basic network administration using MikroTik (routing, configuration, and troubleshooting).
bullet.b6: Delivered N2 and N3 technical support across multiple business areas.
bullet.b7: Organized development and support tasks using Kanban and ticket-based workflows.

projects.title: Projects

note-app.title: Note App
note-app.subtitle: Personal project · Full Stack · REST API + SPA
note-app.description: Production-ready full-stack notes management system built with Spring Boot and React. The application exposes a RESTful API secured with JWT authentication and supports full note lifecycle management, including creation, categorization, archiving, and filtering. Designed with clean architecture principles, DTO validation, and a containerized setup for consistent local development.

highlights.api: REST API with validations and DTOs

CoderHouse-project.title: Coder House Project
CoderHouse-project.subtitle: Personal project · Frontend · Vanilla JS
CoderHouse-project.description: Interactive web project developed as the final assignment of the CoderHouse bootcamp, aimed at showcasing a strong and modern use of vanilla JavaScript without relying on frameworks. It features dynamic DOM manipulation, form validation, and functional logic, prioritizing a clear, efficient, and scalable user experience. The project represents a solid technical foundation for further development with technologies such as React.

highlights.events: Event handling and logic in pure JS

IUA-project-PHP.title: PHP IUA Project
IUA-project-PHP.subtitle: Personal project · Full Stack · MVC Architecture
IUA-project-PHP.description: Web project developed as the final assignment of the PHP bootcamp at the IUA University, aimed at showcasing a strong and modern use of PHP without relying on frameworks. It features MVC architecture, form validation, and functional logic, prioritizing a clear, efficient, and scalable user experience.
